arg.name: help
arg.description: ask for the list of command line arguments accepted by GGobi and a brief description of each.

arg.name: s
arg.description: specifies the input mode as being S data, i.e. coming from an S process.
arg.quickHelp: use S as the data mode

arg.name: ascii
arg.description: specifies the input mode as being ASCII, the old-style xgobi format in which the data, variable names, record labels, colors, etc. are given in separate but parallel files identified by particular extensions.
arg.quickHelp: use the xgobi-style ASCII data mode

arg.name: xml
arg.description: specifies the input mode as being XML, the new style GGobi format which allows multiple self-contained datasets to be included in a single file, URI, string, etc.

arg.name: mysql
arg.description: currently ignored. Intended to specify that one should use the MySQL plugin to read the data. This is now done via

arg.name: validate
arg.description: activate validation mode when reading XML input. This is only supported if configured with support for XML.

arg.name: verbose
arg.description: set the level of diagnostic output to high which means that GGobi will print a lot of messages to the console indicating what it is currently doing. This is useful for debugging.
arg.quickHelp: display verbose diagnostic output on console

arg.name: silent
arg.description: set the diagnostic output to off so that very few messages are printed to the screen.
arg.quickHelp: display little or no diagnostic output

arg.name: version
arg.description: print the version information on the console. This should be used when submitting a bug report.

arg.name: init
noinit
arg.description: specifies that no initialization file should be used.

arg.name: colorschemes
arg.description: specify the name of the XML source file or URL from which to read the session-wide colorschemes to use within GGobi.
arg.quickHelp: name of XML file containing color scheme descriptions.

arg.name: activeColorScheme
arg.description: specify the name of the active/default colorscheme to use in a newly created GGobi. The value should exactly match the name of the desired colorscheme given in the XML file.
arg.quickHelp: name of the default color scheme to use

arg.name: datamode
arg.description: specifies the mode for reading the data. This gives the input mechanism a hint and can also be used to identify a particular input plugin by giving its modeName value.

arg.name: keepalive
arg.description: toggles whether to quit when there are no GGobi instances remaining. By default, this is true. So specifying this argument turns it off and means that the GGobi session will persist eventhough there are no GGobis and no way for the user to interact with the session via a GUI. This is for use when embedding GGobi within other applications and/or languages, e.g. RSggobi
arg.quickHelp: don't terminate if no GGobi windows are open

arg.name: restore
arg.description: specifies the name of a file/URL containing a description of a previous GGobi session which will be used to attempt to recreate that session.
arg.quickHelp: restore a previously saved GGobi session.
